page.title: 10Dismantled Railway, Alcester
page.content: A dismantled railway crosses the area from Alcester to Great Alne. Some of it can be "walked", as one Alcester child found out: "Through our area there runs a dismantled railway line. Just N. of the triangulation point it has been filled in with rubbish, and wildlife has taken over. Another section has factories built over it. We liked the part where we could walk. Alongside Springfield Nurseries people walk dogs or take a stroll, but this path is also a useful short cut. We saw lots of wild flowers when we walked along here. It is a good play area for children who want to make dens or paddle in the river by Black Bridge. Near the bridge a few old sleeper brackets are still set in the path to remind ramblers of its original use."
